page.title: 20GENERAL IMPRESSIONS.
page.content: The area of Southwold and Reydon, particularly Southwold,is a paradox: it is several miles from the nearest major road and badly signposted. As a result, it is a holiday resort which is only visited by people who know of its existence because they have previously visited it. Its isolation and the out_of_date attitudes of the local residents (who want to preserve the area without any change) are among the reasons why many people enjoy visiting Southwold,thus causing the character of the town to change during the Summer. For these reasons also people wish to retire to the area and this causes significant changes in the population and the nature of the area itself. Under these pressures it will be interesting to see how long the area can survive in its present form.
